WYOMING CONSOLIDATED PLANNING GRANT

PURPOSE:WYDOT IS APPLYING FOR A TOTAL OF $284715 IN SECTION 5304 PLANNING FORMULA FUNDS FOR COMPLETING TRANSIT PLANNING STUDIES AND RELATED ACTIVITIES. THE TOTAL FTA AMOUNT (PROVIDED AT AN 80/20 MATCHING RATIO) IS COMPOSED OF THE FOLLOWING AMOUNTS:$ 31660- REMAINING APPORTIONMENT OF FFY2019 FUNDS (LAPSING)$122106 - THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF FFY2020 FUNDS$130949 - THE FULL APPORTIONMENT OF FFY2021 FUNDS$284715- TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDING ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE GRANT SCOPE OF WORK IS ORGANIZED INTO THREE PROJECTS FOR THREE SEPARATE AGENCIES AS DESCRIBED IN MORE DETAIL BELOW.PROJECT #1. SOUTHERN TETON AREA RAPID TRANSIT (START) - AN AMOUNT OF $120000 IN FTA FUNDS TO REVIEW POSSIBLE TRANSPORTATION ALTERNATIVES FOR SERVICE TO THE JACKSON HOLE AIRPORT BASED ON RESULTS OF SURVEYS AND STATISTICAL ANALYSIS THAT THIS PROJECT WILL FUND. PROJECT #2. WYDOT TRANSIT PROGRAM GRANTS MANAGEMENT PERFORMANCE BASED PLANNING PROJECT - AN AMOUNT OF $39840 IN FTA FUNDS TO CONTINUE TO FUND WYDOTS ONGOING PROJECT FUNDED EACH YEAR WITH PLANNING FUNDS TO UTILIZE BLACKCAT TO ASSIST WITH PERFORMANCE BASED PLANNING CURRENTLY BEING USED FOR THE WYDOT TRANSIT PROGRAM. PROJECT #3. TETON COUNTY - AN AMOUNT OF $124875 IN INITIAL FTA FUNDS FOR PLANNING AND CONCEPTUAL DESIGN FOR THE STILSON TRANSIT CENTER PROJECT. THE PROJECT INCLUDES PLANNING CONCEPTUAL DESIGN OUTREACH ACTIVITIES AND EVALUATION FOR THE PROPOSED PROJECT TO BE CONSTRUCTED WITH BUILD FUNDS IN A FUTURE FTA APPLICATION.(NOTE: THE TOTAL COST FOR THIS EFFORT EXCEEDS $300000; IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT A PORTION OF FY 2022 PLANNING FUNDS MAY BE ADDED AS A FUTURE AMENDMENT AFTER THE FUNDS ARE APPORTIONED.) EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE TWO PLANNING PROJECTS FOR START AND TETON COUNTY WILL HELP TO FURTHER THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS IN BOTH THE TOWN OF JACKSON AND TETON COUNTY. THE GRANTS MANAGEMENT PROJECT FOR WYDOT IS AN ONGOING PROJECT TO BETTER THE TRANSIT PROGRAM FOR ALL AGENCIES WITH THE BLACKCAT PLATFORM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:TRANSIT AGENCIES AGENCY STAFF AND TRANSIT PASSENGERSSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THIS GRANT WILL FUND PLANNING PROJECTS FOR SOUTHERN TETON AREA RAPID TRANSIT (START) AND TETON COUNTY.OTHER INFORMATION:ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDING RELEVANT PAGES FROM BOTH THE ACTIVE STIP AND THE ANNUAL WORK PROGRAM.LOCAL MATCH IS DOCUMENTED UNDER THE ACTIVITES TO BE PERFORMED SECTION AND IS COMING FROM THE TOWN OF JACKSON WYDOT AND TETON COUNTY.PRE-AWARD STATEMENT: WYDOT IS REQUESTING PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY FOR THE PERFORMANCE BASED PLANNING PROJECT OF $39840 STARTING OCTOBER 1 2021.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS FOR PLANNING WORK FOR MADISONS BRT GREEN LINE BRINGING A MUCH HIGHER QUALITY OF TRANSIT SERVICE TO LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS ON MADISONS NORTH AND SOUTH SIDES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE METRORAPID BRT SYSTEM WILL CONSIST OF 3 LINES IN MADISON: THE EAST-WEST RED LINE NORTH-SOUTH GREEN LINE FUTURE BLUE LINE. THE RED LINE WILL BE COMPLETE IN 2024 AND THE GREEN LINE WILL EXTEND BRT TO THE UNDERSERVED AREAS: SOUTH MADISON NEIGHBORHOODS ALONG PARK STREET AND NORTH MADISON ON AN ALIGNMENT THAT HAS NOT BEEN DETERMINED. THIS PLANNING PROJECT WILL DETERMINE THE ROUTE STATION LOCATIONS RUNNING WAY CHARACTERISTICS AND WILL ACCOMPLISH PRELIMINARY DESIGN AND COMPLETE NEPA ANALYSIS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE GREEN LINE BRT PLANNING PROJECT WILL CONSIST OF SEVERAL PHASES:1. CORRIDOR PLANNING. THIS PHASE WILL CONSIST OF DEVELOPING SEVERAL ALTERNATIVE ALIGNMENTS FOR THE GREEN LINE CORRIDOR. THIS WORK WILL ULTIMATELY RESULT IN A LOCALLY PREFERRED ALTERNATIVE AND A REQUEST TO ENTER PROJECT DEVELOPMENT INTO THE SMALL STARTS PROGRAM.2. PROJECT DEVELOPMENT. THIS PHASE WILL CONSIST OF PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING DESIGN UP TO 30%. PROJECT STAFF WILL WORK WITH THE MADISON AREA MPO TO INCLUDE THE GREEN LINE IN THE FISCALLY CONSTRAINED LONG-RANGE PLAN DURING THIS PHASE.3. ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSIS. THIS PHASE WILL CONSIST OF ENVIRONMENTAL WORK NEEDED TO COMPLETE THE GREEN LINE PROJECT.4. PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT. PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WILL HAPPEN CONTINUOUSLY THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT. PROJECT STAFF AND CONSULTANTS WILL ENGAGE THE PUBLIC AND STAKEHOLDERS THROUGH PUBLIC MEETINGS SMALLER MORE TARGETED MEETINGS AN ONLINE PRESENCE SURVEYS STAKEHOLDER MEETINGS AND BY HAVING A PERSONAL PRESENCE IN THE COMMUNITY. THE CITY WILL BUILD ON EXPERIENCES GAINED WHILE IMPLEMENTING THE RED LINE AND USE NEW TOOLS TO ENGAGE DISADVANTAGED GROUPS WITH A FOCUS ON EQUITABLE REPRESENTATION BY LOW-INCOME PEOPLE AND PEOPLE OF COLOR.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFIT FOR THE CITY OF MADISON AND DANE COUNTY RIDERS WILL BE THE IMPROVED TRANSIT OPTIONS WHICH ENHANCE THE PUBLIC TRANSIT EXPERIENCE ESPECIALLY ON THE NORTH AND SOUTH SIDES OF MADISON THAT ARE UNDERSERVED AND CONTAIN THE FOLLOWING AREAS OF PERSISTENT POVERTY CENSUS TRACTS: 11.01 12 14.01 14.02 23.01 24.02 AND 25; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (WISDOT) IS APPLYING FOR $700000 OF WISCONSINS APPORTIONED SECTION 5304 FUNDS . THIS APPLICATION FULLY OBLIGATES WISDOTS FFYS 2018 ($318098) AND 2019 ($324842) APPORTIONMENTS AND $57060 OF WISDOTS FFY 2020 APPORTIONMENT. COLLECTIVELY THE FUNDS WILL FINANCE SIX TRANSIT PLANNING PROJECTS. WISDOT WILL USE FUNDS DIRECTLY FOR ONE OF THESE PROJECTS TO RETAIN A CONTRACTOR THAT WILL CONDUCT CY 2021 AND 2022 TRANSIT SYSTEM MANAGEMENT PERFORMANCE REVIEWS (MPRS) ON OUR BEHALF. WISDOT WILL ALLOCATE REMAINING FUNDS TO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR LOCAL AND REGIONAL TRANSIT PLANNING PROJECTS.FOR THE MPR PROJECT WISDOT WILL MATCH SECTION 5304 FUNDS WITH $40000 IN STATE SEGREGATED TRANSPORTATION FUNDS ALLOCATED FOR TRAFFIC DEMAND MANAGEMENT EFFORTS. FOR LOCAL PLANNING PROJECTS SUBRECIPIENTS WILL MATCH SECTION 5304 FUNDS WITH $135000 IN EITHER LOCAL GENERAL FUNDS OR IN ONE CASE STATE FUNDS ISSUED TO COUNTIES FOR SPECIALIZED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND INITIATIVES. TOTAL MATCH IS 20% ($175000). PROJECT EXPENSE DETAILS ARE PROVIDED ELSEWHERE IN THIS APPLICATION. ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE OUR 2021 STATE TRANSIT PLANNING WORK PROGRAM (TPWP) AND FTA APPROVAL LETTER DATED 07/28/2021 APPLICABLE UPWP EXCERPTS AND FY18-20 APPORTIONMENT TABLES

THIS GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDES $565176 IN FY 2021 SECTION 5304 STATEWIDE PLANNING FUNDING AND WILL BE USED FOR THE WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (WSDOT) STATEWIDE PLANNING ACTIVITIES INCLUDING PROGRAM SUPPORT AND ADMINISTRATION GENERAL DEVELOPMENT/COMPREHENSIVE PLANNING AND SHORT-RANGE PLANNING.THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO:THE GRANT IS USED TO TO COVER MULTIMODAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING INTEGRATION AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES INCLUDING GENERAL DEVELOPMENT / COMPREHENSIVE PLANNING SHORT RANGE TRANSIT PLANNING AND RELATED PROGRAM SUPPORT ADMINISTRATIVE ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT TRANSIT SERVICES AROUND WASHINGTON STATE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: GENERAL DEVELOPMENT / COMPREHENSIVE PLANNING SHORT RANGE TRANSIT PLANNING AND RELATED PROGRAM SUPPORT ADMINISTRATIONEXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROVIDE NECESSARY PLANNING INPUT TO ENSURE PROJECTS ARE DEVELOPED AND DELIVERED IN ALIGNMENT WITH PUBLIC NEEDS FOR ADEQUATE AND SUSTAINABLE ACCESS TO THE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM. MAINTAINING EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATIONS WHEN CONDUCTING OUTREACH TO COMMUNITIES AND EXECUTING IDEAS RELATED TO MULTIMODAL SYSTEM PLANNING AND INTEGRATION. ENSURE COORDINATION BETWEEN WSDOT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS AND PLANNING ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE STATE IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF INTEGRATED MULTIMODAL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM THAT PROVIDES SERVICES TO THE DIFFERENT COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CUSTOMERS WHO UTILIZE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN RURAL AND METROPOLITAN AREAS ACROSS THE STATE OF WASHINGTON INCLUDING THE ELDERLY PERSONS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS LOW-INCOME AND GENERAL PUBLIC. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: FUNDS WILL BE USED BY WSDOT TO SUPPORT STATEWIDE MULTIMODAL SYSTEM PLANNING AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES. WSDOT WILL ADMINISTER THE PROGRAM AND IDENTIFY AND COORDINATE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM NEEDS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS REQUEST IS TO UTILIZE AREAS OF PERSISTENT POVERTY DISCRETIONARY GRANT FUNDS TO CONDUCT A PLANNING STUDY OF POTENTIAL TRANSIT IMPROVEMENTS TO BETTER SERVE THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS TERRITORY BY PROVIDING MORE FREQUENT SERVICE AND GIVING ACCESS TO MORE ESSENTIAL DESTINATIONS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE A FEASIBILITY STUDY OF NEW FIXED AND MICROTRANSIT ROUTES OUR EXISTING ROUTES AND A SURVEY REGARDING EXISTING ROUTES TO EVALUATE EXPANSION OF SERVICE HOURS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE POTENTIAL NEW AND EXPANDED ROUTES WOULD CREATE SHORTER RIDE TIMES MORE DIRECT ACCESS TO OTHER ROUTES AND DESTINATIONS AND WOULD SERVE A LARGER GEOGRAPHIC AREA IN NEED OF TRANSIT SERVICES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROJECT WILL SERVE THE ENTIRETY OF THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS INCLUDING ST. THOMAS ST. CROIX AND ST. JOHN.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT THE FUNDING OF 14 METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATIONS (MPO) SO THAT THEY CAN CARRY OUT THE ACTIVITIES IN THEIR FY2024 UNIFIED PLANNING WORK PROGRAMS (UPWP). IT IS ALSO TO SUPPORT THE PLANNING ACTIVITIES OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER THE ACTIVITIES IN THE APPROVED UPWPS OF OUR 14 MPOS WHICH INCLUDE GENERAL PLANNING AND PROGRAMMING SHORT AND LONG-TERM PLANNING TIP DEVELOPMENT TRANSIT STUDIES HUMAN SERVICE TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION AND ADDRESSING SAFETY AND SECURITY ISSUES. THE COMMONWEALTH WILL ALSO HELP TRANSIT AGENCIES DEVELOP TRANSIT DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS (TDPS) AND TRANSIT STRATEGIC PLANS (TSPS). STUDIES AND SURVEYS TO HELP IMPROVE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES IN THE COMMONWEALTH WILL ALSO BE FUNDED.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING ENSURES THE MPOS AND THE COMMONWEALTH ARE CARRYING OUT TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITIES TO COMPLY WITH FEDERAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING REGULATIONS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALL CITIZENS OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA THAT RELY ON EFFICIENT SAFE AND EFFECTIVE TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AND FACILITIES TO GET THEM WHERE THEY NEED TO GO.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: FUNDS WILL BE GIVEN TO THE FOLLOWING MPOS TO COVER THE ACTIVITIES IN THEIR APPROVED UPWPS: ROANOKE VALLEY MPO HAMPTON ROADS TPO RICHMOND REGIONAL TPO TRI-CITIES MPO WASHINGTON D.C. MPO (METROPOLITAN WASHINGTON COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS OR MWCOG) FREDERICKSBURG MPO HARRISONBURG-ROCKINGHAM MPO STAUNTON-AUGUSTA-WAYNESBORO MPO CHARLOTTESVILLE MPO BRISTOL MPO KINGSPORT MPO WINCHESTER MPO LYNCHBURG MPO AND NEW RIVER VALLEY MPO. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE GIVEN TO THE THOMAS JEFFERSON PDC TO CONDUCT A STUDY THEIR REGIONAL TRANSIT AND THE ROANOKE VALLEY-ALLEGHANY REGIONAL COMMISSION TO CONDUCT A SURVEY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE TRANSPORTATION USAGE IN THEIR REGION.

NASHVILLE MTA WAS AWARDED FISCAL YEAR 2020 HELPING OBTAIN PROSPERITY FOR EVERYONE (HOPE) PROGRAM FUNDING TO CONDUCT EXTENSIVE COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGINEERING FOR THE NORTH NASHVILLE TRANSIT CENTER. THE $20000 IN LOCAL MATCH THIS PROJECT ARE CAPITAL CITY BONDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE CAPITAL SPENDING PLAN THAT WAS APPROVED BY THE NASHVILLE METROPOLITAN COUNCIL FOR CAPITAL FUNDING. A COPY OF THE GRANTS.GOV APPLICATION HAS BEEN ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION. NASHVILLE MTA PLANS TO UTILIZES THE AWARDED FUNDING FOR COMMUNITY OUTREACH. THE NORTH NASHVILLE TRANSIT CENTER WILL BE A NEW NEIGHBORHOOD MOBILITY CENTER DESIGNED SPECIFICALLY TO CREATE AND ENHANCE MULTIMODAL TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS CONNECTIONS AND ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITIES FOR NORTH NASHVILLE AN ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITY WITHIN THE NASHVILLE METROPOLITAN AREA. THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION HAS AWARDED $7.2 MILLION DOLLARS IN STATE IMPROVE ACT FUNDING THAT IS BEING MATCH BY $1.8 MILLION LOCAL DOLLARS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE TRANSIT CENTER. FTA PROVIDED CONCURRENCE THAT THE TRANSIT CENTER LOCATED AT 2521 CLARKSVILLE PIKE NASHVILLE TN 37208 QUALIFIED AS A CATEGORICAL EXCLUSION. A COPY OF THE CONCURRENCE LETTER AND THE CE DOCUMENT HAVE BEEN ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION. THE PROJECT ARE IN THE MOST RECENTLY APPROVED TIP AS TIP PROJECT # 2011-111-069.NASHVILLE MTA WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). 6-30-15: REQUESTING FY 12 STATEWIDE PLANNING FUNDS FOR THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS: 442-100 PROGRAM SUPPORT ADMINISTRATION:PRAIRIE HILLS TRANSIT ALONG WITH A SD DOT STAFF PERSON WILL BE ON LOCATION AT RIDE-CONNECTION IN PORTLAND OREGON FOR TRAINING ON THEIR SUCCESSFUL VOLUNTEER PROGRAM. THE VOLUNTEER PROGRAM RECRUITS VETERANS TO DRIVE VETERANS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS. ALONG WITH THE PROGRAM TRAINING RIDE-CONNECTION WILL ASSIST IN PRINTED MATERIALS USED FOR RECRUITMENT VOLUNTEER FORMS REIMBURSEMENT POLICIES ETC. THE PRAIRIE HILLS SERVICE AREA HAS THREE VETERANS HOSPITALS AND CLINICS AND A STATE VETERANS HOME. WITH IMPLEMENTING THIS PROGRAM IN THEIR SERVICE AREA (12000 SQ. MILES) IT WILL HELP TO MEET SOME OF THE MANY UNMET TRANSPORTATION NEED IN THEIR AREA. BY RECRUITING VETERANS TO DRIVER VETERANS THE POOL OF WILLING DRIVERS MAY BE LARGER.SD DOT WOULD ARRANGE AND OFFER A SERIES OF PLANNING RELATED TRAINING SESSIONS FOR THE RURAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS TO ATTEND TO GAIN MORE EDUCATION REGARDING PLANNING METHODS. FOR EXAMPLE SOME OF THE SESSIONS WOULD BE TRAINING PERTAINING TO BUSINESS PLAN DEVELOPMENT FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT FOR TRANSIT OPERATORS FUNDRAISING AND CREATING LOCAL MATCH ETC.442-700 OTHER ACTIVITIES:RIVER CITIES TRANSIT - RIVER CITIES TRANSIT MANAGEMENT WILL COLLABORATE SERVICES AND CONNECT KINGSBURY COUNTY TO PEOPLES TRANSIT TO OFFER TRANSIT SERVICE. RIVER CITIES TRANSIT WOULD SHARE KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERTISE WITH OTHER AGENCIES TO NOT ONLY CREATE PARTNERSHIPS BUT TO IMPROVE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS. RIVER CITIES WILL ASSIST IN THE PLANNING OF A NEEDS ASSESSMENT TO GAUGE THE SCOPE FOR THE PROJECT. THE NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND THE GATHERING OF INFORMATION WILL REQUIRE A MULTITUDE OF PLANNING MEETINGS TO HELP GET THE TRANSIT ORGANIZATIONS OFF THE GROUND. SOME OF THE EFFORTS CAN BE COMPLETED OFF SITE BUT AN UNDETERMINED AMOUNT OF TIME AND EFFORT WILL NEED TO BE SPENT IN KINGSBURY COUNTY AREA RESEARCHING THE NEEDS AND POSSIBLE FUNDING SOURCES FOR THE PROJECT. RIVER CITY TRANSIT IN CONJUNCTION WITH PEOPLES TRANSIT WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT TRAINING AND MENTORING TO KINGSBURY COUNTY FOR A YEAR TO ENSURE COMPLETE SUCCESS AND SUSTAINABILITY OF THE PROJECT.SD RURAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS - TO PROVIDE PLANNING FUND IN THE DEVELOPMENT OR UPDATING BUSINESS PLANS FOR RURAL TRANSIT PROVIDERS.

THESE PLANNING FUNDS HAVE BEEN PROGRAMMED IN THE UPWP 2022-2023 AMENDMENT #1 (APPROVED BY THE PUERTO RICO MPO ON APRIL 6 AND 29 2022; AWAITING APPROVAL FROM FTA/FHWA). PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDED IN THIS APPLICATION IS TO GIVE THE MUNICIPALITIES AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THE TOOLS FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THEIR PUBLIC TRANSIT SYSTEMS. THIS WILL RESULT IN SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENT OF QUALITY OF LIFE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT FOR THE MUNICIPALITIES AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE STUDIES WILL ALLOW THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE TRANSIT SYSTEM TO ENHANCE THE ACCESSIBILITY TO THE CITIZENS ESPECIALLY SENIORS INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO THE COMMERCIAL AREAS URBAN AREAS SERVICES AREAS AND GOVERNMENT OFFICES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PLANNING ACTIVITIES ARE EXPECTED TO BE PERFORMED SUCH AS: REVIEW OF APPLICABLE PLANNING DOCUMENTS IN ORDER TO ASSESS THE CURRENT LAND USE AND TRANSPORTATION FRAMEWORK. ASSESSMENT OF DEMOGRAPHIC TRENDS AND PROJECTIONS ASSESSMENT OF THE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS INCLUDING ROAD TRANSIT PEDESTRIAN AND CYCLIST INFRASTRUCTURE. DEVELOP A VISION GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOR THE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM. MUNICIPAL AND REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS: MAJOR ACTIVITY CENTERS SURVEYS EVALUATION OF ROAD INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDS AND DEFICIENCIESEVALUATION OF PROPOSED NETWORKS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PLANS FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS ARE EXPECTED TO BE THE RESULT OF THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS APPLICATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS OF THE DIFFERENT MUNICIPALITIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:-COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION STUDY FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF AGUADA-$100000-PLAN AND DESIGN OF COMPLETE STREETS OF MUNICIPALITY OF CAMUY-$100000-COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION STUDY FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF CIALES-$100000-COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION STUDY FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF CEIBA-$81000-COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION STUDY FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF LAS PIEDRAS-$81000-COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION STUDY FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF MARICAO-$70000-COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION STUDY FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF MAYAGUEZ-$130000-COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION STUDY FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF PEUELAS-$81000-DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A TRANSIT AND TRANSPORTATION PLAN SYSTEM FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF SABANA GRANDE-$100000-PLAN OF COMPLETE STREETS FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF SAN LORENZO-$85000-PLAN OF COMPLETE STREETS FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF TRUJILLO ALTO-$85000-FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR A TRANSPORTATION CONNECTIVITY SYSTEM IN THE EL CINCO SECTOR ZONE IN RIO PIEDRAS SAN JUAN-UPR-$100000-COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION STUDY FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF UTUADO-$100000TOTAL: $1213000*NEW PROJECTS UNDER WORK ELEMENT #3 WILL BE INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT. APPLICATION PURPOSE: TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR A STUDY TO EVALUATE NEW TRANSIT OPTIONS TO LINK THE PITTSBURGHS STRIP DISTRICT HILL DISTRICT OAKLAND HAZELWOOD CARRICK AND OVERBROOK NEIGHBORHOODS.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE PROJECT WOULD ESTABLISH NEW TRANSIT LINKAGES IN A 7.5-MILE CORRIDOR OVERCOMING TOPOGRAPHIC BARRIERS POSED BY HILLS VALLEYS AND A RIVER WHILE GREATLY INCREASING EFFICIENCY OF TRAVEL BETWEEN THE CITYS EASTERN AND SOUTHERN NEIGHBORHOODS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:AN EVALUATION OF TRANSIT TECHNOLOGIES ROUTE ALIGNMENTS AND STATION LOCATIONS WITH PRELIMINARY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR ALL THREE; FORECASTING THE ALTERNATIVES RIDERSHIP; DEVELOPING AN OPERATING PLAN; DEVELOPING CAPITAL OPERATING COST ESTIMATES FOR THE ALTERNATIVES; EVALUATION OF EXTENT TO WHICH THE ALTERNATIVES ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND CLIMATE CHANGE; DEVELOPING A SCHEDULE FOR FURTHER PLANNING AS WELL AS FOR THE NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT (NEPA) REVIEW PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING FINAL DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION PHASES FOR THE PROJECT; THREE ROUNDS OF PUBLIC OUTREACH IN THE STRIP DISTRICT HILL DISTRICT OAKLAND HAZELWOOD/GLEN HAZEL AND CARRICK/OVERBROOK NEIGHBORHOODS; ONE ROUND OF STATION/COMMUNITY DESIGN WORKSHOPS TO DISCUSS HOW THE SYSTEM WOULD BE INTEGRATED FUNCTIONALLY AND VISUALLY INTO THE COMMUNITIES; AND ADDITIONAL MEETINGS WITH THE PUBLIC AND STAKEHOLDERS AS NEEDED.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EVALUATION STUDY AND PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT REGARDING OPTIONS TO LINK THE CITYS STRIP DISTRICT HILL DISTRICT OAKLAND HAZELWOOD CARRICK AND OVERBROOK NEIGHBORHOODS THROUGH TRANSIT.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: HILL DISTRICT OAKLAND HAZELWOOD/GLEN HAZEL CARRICK AND OVERBROOK RESIDENTS ARE UNEMPLOYED OR UNDER EMPLOYED. THESE RESIDENTS NEED IMPROVED CONNECTIONS FROM THESE NEIGHBORHOODS TO EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN THE STRIP DISTRICT OAKLAND HAZELWOOD AND ELSEWHERE IN THE CITY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

THE SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (SEPTA) IS APPLYING FY 2020 HELPING OBTAIN PROSPERITY FOR EVERYONE (HOPE) PROGRAM FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $495000 TO SUPPORT REVIEW AND CONSOLIDATION OF EXISTING PLANS AND PROJECTS STAKEHOLDER MEETINGS AND PUBLIC OUTREACH ACTIVITIES FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A SINGLE PREFERRED CONCEPT PLAN FOR THE GRAYS AVENUE CORRIDOR.ON OCTOBER 7 2020 FTA ANNOUNCED ON THE FTA WEBSITE (SEE ATTACHED UNDER APPLICATION DOCUMENTS) ITS SELECTION OF PROJECTS FUNDED UNDER THE FY 2020 HOPE PROGRAM FUNDS. IN THIS ANNOUNCEMENT SEPTA AND THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA WERE SELECTED TO RECEIVE $495000 IN FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) HOPE PROGRAM FUNDING MADE AVAILABLE UNDER THE AUTHORIZING LEGISLATION (THE FURTHER CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT 2020 PUBLIC LAW 1162). A COPY OF SEPTAS HOPE PROGRAM APPLICATION AND PROPOSAL PROFILE IS ATTACHED TO THIS APPLICATION UNDER APPLICATION DOCUMENTS. THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE FOR THIS PROJECT (10% OR $55000) WILL BE PROVIDED IN-KIND BY SEPTA ($37000) AND THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA ($18000). ( PLEASE NOTE THAT THE CITY ORIGINALLY COMMITTED $30000 IN IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS BUT WHEN SEPTA WAS AWARDED A LOWER AMOUNT ($495000) THAN THEY HAD ORIGINALLY APPLIED FOR ($850000) SEPTA AND THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA AGREED TO A LOWER CITY CONTRIBUTION ($18000). THE IN-KIND CONTRIBUTION FROM BOTH SEPTA AND THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA CONSISTS OF LABOR (PROJECT MANAGEMENT) SERVICES.PURPOSE OF AWARD TO FUND THE IMPLEMENTATION OF FY 2020 HELPING OBTAIN PROSPERITY FOR EVERYONE (HOPE) PROGRAM FUNDS FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A SINGLE PREFERRED CONCEPT PLAN FOR THE GRAYS AVENUE CORRIDOR IN PHILADELPHIA PA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED - REVIEWING/CONSOLIDATING EXISTING PLANS AND PROJECTS; AND CONDUCTING STAKEHOLDER MEETINGS AND PUBLIC OUTREACH ACTIVITIES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES TO IMPLEMENT A SEPTA PLANNING EFFORT THAT RESULTS IN AN IMPROVED TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM WITHIN THE GRAYS AVENUE CORRIDOR.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES - TRANSIT RIDERS AND RESIDENTS WITHIN THE GRAYS AVENUE CORRIDOR WITHIN THE PHILADELPHIA PA REGION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

MPOS USE CARRYOVER FUNDING AS A FUNDING MECHANISM FOR MULTI-YEAR PROJECTS.THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (NYSDOT) SUBMITS EXECUTES AND MANAGES THE DEPARTMENTS ANNUAL FTA GRANT AGREEMENTS FOR SECTION 5303 (MPO WORK PROGRAMS) AND SECTION 5304 (FTA STATEWIDE PLANNING AND RESEARCH) FUNDING. IT HAS BEEN THE DEPARTMENTS POLICY TO SUBMIT THESE TWO GRANTS TOGETHER EVEN THOUGH ONE IS FUNDED FROM THE HIGHWAY TRUST FUND AND THE OTHER FROM A FEDERAL GENERAL REVENUE SOURCE. NYS METROPOLITAN AND STATEWIDE PLANNING/SPRNYSDOT IS REQUESTING FEDERAL ASSISTANCE IN THE AMOUNT OF $8544824 FOR FTA SECTION 5303 AND $1795719 FOR FTA SECTION 5304 (FFY21 FUNDS) FOR THE SUPPORT OF PLANNING FOR THE 14 NEW YORK STATE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATIONS (MPOS) AND STATEWIDE INITIATIVES. PURPOSE OF AWARD: PROVIDES FUNDING AND PROCEDURAL REQUIREMENTS FOR MULTIMODAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING IN METROPOLITAN AREAS AND STATES THAT IS COOPERATIVE CONTINUOUS AND COMPREHENSIVE RESULTING IN LONG-RANGE PLANS AND SHORT-RANGE PROGRAMS OF TRANSPORTATION INVESTMENT PRIORITIES. THE PLANNING PROGRAMS ARE JOINTLY ADMINISTERED BY FTA AND THE FEDERAL HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION (FHWA) WHICH PROVIDES ADDITIONAL FUNDING. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DEVELOP TRANSPORTATION PLANS AND PROGRAMS PLAN DESIGN AND EVALUATE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS AND CONDUCT TECHNICAL STUDIES RELATED TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING IS USED TO FULFILL REQUIREMENTS OF 49 U.S.C. 5303 AND 5304.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS INCLUDE STATES AND METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATIONS. NYS MPOS (IN ALPHABETICAL ORDER): (1) ADIRONDACK-GLENS FALLS TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (A/GFTC); (2) BINGHAMTON METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION STUDY (BMTS); (3) CAPITAL DISTRICT TRANSPORTATION COMMITTEE (CDTC); (4) DUTCHESS COUNTY TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (DCTC); (5) ELMIRA-CHEMUNG TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (ECTC); (6) GREATER BUFFALO-NIAGARA REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (GBNRTC); (7) GENESEE TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (GTC); (8) HERKIMER-ONEIDA COUNTIES TRANSPORTATION STUDY (HOCTS); (9) ITHACA TOMPKINS COUNTY TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (ITCTC); (10) NEW YORK METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (NYMTC); (11) ORANGE COUNTY TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (OCTC); (12) SYRACUSE METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (SMTC); (13) ULSTER COUNTY TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (UCTC); (14) WATERTOWN JEFFERSON COUNTY AREA TRANSPORTATION COUNCIL (WJCTC).SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: DEVELOPMENT OF FEDERALLY REQUIRED PLANNING PRODUCTS

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE STATEWIDE PLANNING FUNDS PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR PLANNING SUPPORT TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS; AND HUMAN RESOURCE PROGRAMS. FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE FOR PLANNING ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT THE ECONOMIC VITALITY OF THE METROPOLITAN AREA BY ENABLING GLOBAL COMPETITIVENESS PRODUCTIVITY AND EFFICIENCY; INCREASE THE SAFETY AND SECURITY OF THE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM; INCREASE THE ACCESSIBILITY AND MOBILITY OF PEOPLE AND FOR FREIGHT; PROTECT AND ENHANCE THE ENVIRONMENT PROMOTE ENERGY CONSERVATION IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND PROMOTE CONSISTENCY BETWEEN TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENTS AND STATE AND LOCAL PLANNED GROWTH AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PATTERNS; ENHANCE THE INTEGRATION AND CONNECTIVITY OF THE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM ACROSS AND BETWEEN MODES FOR PEOPLE AND FREIGHT; AND ULTIMATELY PROMOTE EFFICIENT SYSTEM MANAGEMENT AND OPERATION.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: NMDOT USES THESE FUNDS TO CONDUCT RURAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING STUDIES DIRECTLY OR TO AWARD GRANTS FOR RURAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROJECTS AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. THE METROPOLITAN PLANNING PROGRAMS WILL BE USED FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION AND SUPPORT GENERAL DEVELOPMENT AND PLANNING LONG AND SHORT RANGE TRANSIT PLANNING TIP DEVELOPMENT AND OTHER ACTIVITIES FOR BOTH CONTINUING AND NEW PROJECTS. THE MPOS USE THE FOLLOWING ALLOWABLE LOCAL 80/20 MATCH. PREPARING TRANSPORTATION PLANS AND PROGRAMS; PLANNING ENGINEERING DESIGNING AND EVALUATING A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECT; AND CONDUCTING TECHNICAL STUDIES RELATED TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. IN CARRYING OUT THE METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS THE MPOS THE STATE AND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPERATOR(S) WITHIN THE RESPECTIVE MPO PLANNING AREA COOPERATIVELY DETERMINE THEIR MUTUAL RESPONSIBILITIES. REIMBURSEMENTS FOR SERVICE INCLUDE OPERATING COSTS SUPPLIES TRAINING LICENSES AND PERMITS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: NMDOT TRANSIT AGENCIES AND THE RTPOS AND MPOS WHO REQUEST AND ARE AWARDED FUNDING FOR PUBLIC TRANSIT SPECIFIC PLANNING PROJECTS ARE ABLE TO COMPLETE TRANSIT PLANNING STUDIES AND BETTER SERVE NEW MEXICO. EACH OF THE FIVE MPOS UTILIZE FUNDS TO CARRY OUT THE UNIFIED PLANNING WORK PROGRAM (UPWP) AND MEET THE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING REQUIREMENTS OF THE JOINT FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA)/FEDERAL HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION (FHWA) PLANNING REGULATIONS. AS PART OF THE BIENNIAL UPWP DEVELOPMENT PROCESS EACH MPO SUBMITS ITS PROPOSED UPWP TO THE TRANSIT AND RAIL DIVISION PRIOR TO ADOPTION BY THE MPO GOVERNING BODY IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THAT ALL FTA PLANNING REQUIREMENTS ARE MET.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NMDOT TRANSIT AND RAIL DIVISION (DIRECT) RURAL AND SMALL URBAN TRANSIT AGENCIES AND RTPOS AND MPOS WITHIN THE STATE REQUESTING FUNDING FOR PLANNING PROJECTS AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. THE FIVE MPOS TO BE FUNDED INCLUDE MID REGION COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (MRCOG) SANTA FE MPO MESILLA VALLEY MPO (LAS CRUCES) EL PASO MPO (SUNLAND PARK) AND FARMINGTON MPO. STATEWIDE PLANNING FUNDING IS FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION AND SPECIAL PLANNING STUDIES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PROVIDE PLANNING SUPPORT FOR NON-URBANIZED AREAS RESEARCH DEVELOPMENT AND DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS AND FELLOWSHIPS FOR TRAINING IN THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION FIELD UNIVERSITY RESEARCH AND HUMAN RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT. THE MPOS USE THE FOLLOWING ALLOWABLE LOCAL 80/20 MATCH. PREPARING TRANSPORTATION PLANS AND PROGRAMS; PLANNING ENGINEERING DESIGNING AND EVALUATING A PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION PROJECT; AND CONDUCTING TECHNICAL STUDIES RELATED TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION. IN CARRYING OUT THE METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS THE MPOS THE STATE AND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPERATOR(S) WITHIN THE RESPECTIVE MPO PLANNING AREA COOPERATIVELY DETERMINE THEIR MUTUAL RESPONSIBILITIES. REIMBURSEMENTS FOR SERVICE INCLUDE OPERATING COSTS SUPPLIES TRAINING LICENSES AND PERMITS.

NMDOT IS APPLYING FOR $210000 GRANT FUNDING RECEIVED ON OCTOBER 7 2020 THROUGH THE HELPING OBTAIN PROSPERITY FOR EVERYONE (HOPE) PROGRAM AWARD. THE PROJECT FUNDING SERVES TO CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY AND SITE SELECTION STUDY FOR A TRANSFER FACILITY; DEVELOP A PLAN FOR SERVICE EXPANSION/COORDINATION; PUBLISH TRANSIT DATA IN GENERAL TRANSIT FEED SPECIFICATION (GTFS); AND CONDUCT AN INTELLIGENT TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM (ITS) ASSESSMENT FOR BUSES IN A COORDINATED EFFORT AMONG GALLUP RURAL TRANSIT NAVAJO NATION AND PUEBLO OF ZUNI IN THE NM REGION OF NEW MEXICO. NMDOT WILL MANAGE THE PROJECT. NMDOT HAS A COMPETITIVELY PROCURED ON-CALL CONTRACTOR TO CONDUCT THE WORK. THE PLAN IS TO USE THE SAME CONTRACTOR FOR EACH STUDY TO ENSURE CONTINUITY.GALLUP IS THE REGIONAL CENTER FOR EMPLOYMENT HEALTHCARE ADDICTION SERVICES EDUCATION SHOPPING AND RECREATION. GALLUP EXPRESS OPERATES TRANSIT SERVICE IN GALLUP. PUEBLO OF ZUNI AND NAVAJO NATION OPERATE SERVICE TO AND FROM GALLUP AND WITHIN THEIR RESERVATIONS. FOR MANY TRIPS ZUNI AND NAVAJO RIDERS MUST TRANSFER TO GALLUP EXPRESS. THERE IS NO CENTRAL TRANSFER POINT OR FACILITY. EACH PROVIDER HAS A SEPARATE SCHEDULE FARE STRUCTURE AND MEDIA AND STOPS. NAVAJO COMMUNITIES ALONG THE ZUNI BORDER HAVE NO TRANSIT SERVICE. THESE COMMUNITIES TRAVEL THROUGH ZUNI TO GALLUP. IMPROVED SERVICE TO ALBUQUERQUE IS NEEDED. THE PROPOSED WORK PLAN IS TO: CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY AND SITE SELECTION STUDY FOR A TRANSFER FACILITY; DEVELOP A PLAN FOR SERVICE EXPANSION/COORDINATION COORDINATION STOP ENHANCEMENTS AND FARE COORDINATION; PUBLISH TRANSIT DATA IN GENERAL TRANSIT FEED SPECIFICATION (GTFS); AND CONDUCT AN INTELLIGENT TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM (ITS) ASSESSMENT FOR BUSES. THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS TRANSIT SERVICE OPERATED BY NAVAJO NATION IN OPPORTUNITY ZONES 35031943902 AND 35031945200.PURPOSE: GALLUP EXPRESS NAVAJO NATION AND PUEBLO OF ZUNI EACH OPERATE TRANSIT SERVICES WITHIN OR TO AND FROM GALLUP. THE SERVICE AREA IS LOW INCOME. SERVICES OVERLAP FARES AND FARE MEDIA ARE NOT COORDINATED NO TRANSFER CENTER EXISTS AND PASSENGER AMENITIES ARE LACKING. THE LACK OF A TRANSFER CENTER REDUCES CONVENIENCE AND RAISES SAFETY ISSUES. PASSENGERS MUST TRANSFER AT STOPS ON SIDE STREETS WITHOUT AMENITIES AND SECURITY. THERE IS NO TRIP PLANNER SO PASSENGERS MUST READ MULTIPLE SCHEDULES TO COMPLETE A TRIP. THE HIGH VOLUME OF TELEPHONE REQUESTS FOR SCHEDULE INFORMATION AND ARRIVAL INFORMATION TAKES STAFF TIME AWAY FROM OTHER ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONAL DUTIES. AREAS OF THE NAVAJO NATION THAT BORDER THE PUEBLO ZUNI HAVE NO TRANSIT SERVICE AND BECAUSE OF LOCAL TRAVEL PATTERNS IT APPEARS THAT THE SERVICE MAY BE BETTER PROVIDED BY ZUNI. THERE ARE THREE FARE STRUCTURES AND TRANSFER POLICIES WHICH DISCOURAGES TRANSFERS AND RAISES THE FARE. SERVICE TO ALBUQUERQUE NEEDS TO BE ENHANCED. THESE AND OTHER ISSUES WERE IDENTIFIED DURING QUARTERLY MEETINGS THE PROVIDERS AND NMDOT HOLD TO DISCUSS SERVICES AND COORDINATION. THE PROJECT FUNDING SERVES TO CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY AND SITE SELECTION STUDY FOR A TRANSFER FACILITY; DEVELOP A PLAN FOR SERVICE EXPANSION/COORDINATION; PUBLISH TRANSIT DATA IN GENERAL TRANSIT FEED SPECIFICATION (GTFS); AND CONDUCT AN INTELLIGENT TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM (ITS) ASSESSMENT FOR BUSES IN A COORDINATED EFFORT AMONG GALLUP RURAL TRANSIT NAVAJO NATION AND PUEBLO OF ZUNI IN THE NM REGION OF NEW MEXICO.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED WORK PLAN IS TO: CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY AND SITE SELECTION STUDY FOR A TRANSFER FACILITY; DEVELOP A PLAN FOR SERVICE EXPANSION/COORDINATION COORDINATION STOP ENHANCEMENTS AND FARE COORDINATION; PUBLISH TRANSIT DATA IN GENERAL TRANSIT FEED SPECIFICATION (GTFS); AND CONDUCT AN INTELLIGENT TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM (ITS) ASSESSMENT FOR BUSES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL: IMPROVE SYSTEM CONDITION BY DEVELOPING A PLAN FOR A SAFE AND SECURE TRANSFER FACILITY AND IDENTIFYING NEW STOPS AND STOP ENHANCEMENTS; IMPROVE SERVICE RELIABILITY THROUGH AN ASSESSMENT OF ITS BUS TECHNOLOGIES GTFS AND REDUCED WAIT TIME FOR TRANSFERS; ENHANCE ACCESS AND MOBILITY THROUGH EXPANDED AND COORDINATED SERVICE FEWER AND COORDINATED TRANSFERS AND TRIP PLANNING; AND ACCELERATE THE INTRODUCTION OF TECHNOLOGY THROUGH AN ASSESSMENT OF ITS TECHNOLOGIES AND PUBLICATION OF GTFS DATA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: GALLUP EXPRESS NAVAJO NATION AND PUEBLO OF ZUNI TRANSIT AGENCIES AND ALL RIDERSHIP IN AND AROUND THE AREA OF IMPACT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NMDOT HAS RECEIVED COMMITMENT LETTERS FROM GALLUP EXPRESS NAVAJO NATION AND PUEBLO OF ZUNI TO PARTICIPATE IN THE STUDY AND OFFER A STAFF COMMITMENT TO DO SO. THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PARTICIPATION IN DEVELOPING A PLAN FOR A SAFE AND SECURE TRANSFER FACILITY AND IDENTIFYING NEW STOPS AND STOP ENHANCEMENTS; IMPROVE SERVICE RELIABILITY THROUGH AN ASSESSMENT OF ITS BUS TECHNOLOGIES GTFS AND REDUCED WAIT TIME FOR TRANSFERS; ENHANCE ACCESS AND MOBILITY THROUGH EXPANDED AND COORDINATED SERVICE FEWER AND COORDINATED TRANSFERS AND TRIP PLANNING; AND ACCELERATE THE INTRODUCTION OF TECHNOLOGY THROUGH AN ASSESSMENT OF ITS TECHNOLOGIES AND PUBLICATION OF GTFS DATA.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: TO INTRODUCE ENHANCED TRANSIT AND TRANSIT AMENITIES ALONG THE 24TH STREET CORRIDOR IN OMAHA AN AREA IDENTIFIED AS HAVING A HIGH PERCENTAGE OF AREAS OF PERSISTENT POVERTY IN AN ONGOING EFFORT TO ADDRESS EQUITY AND INCLUSION AS WELL AS TO ELEVATE THE RIDER EXPERIENCE THROUGH UPGRADED TRANSIT INFRASTRUCTURE NEW AND ADDITIONAL TRANSIT TECHNOLOGIES AND STATE-OF-THE-ART STATION AMENITIES AIMED AT STREAMLINING THE TRAVEL EXPERIENCE WITH METRO ALONG WITH ATTENTION TO ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND SUSTAINABILITY WITH THE INTRODUCTION OF ADDITIONAL ELECTRIC BUSES INTO THE METRO FLEET.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: PROGRAM FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROMOTE CONNECTIONS ALONG A 7.9 MILE CORRIDOR FROM THE NORTH OMAHA TRANSIT CENTER TO THE METROPOLITAN COMMUNITY COLLEGE SOUTH TRANSIT CENTER. THE PLAN WILL IDENTIFY TRANSIT ENHANCEMENTS INCLUDING UPGRADES TO THE ROADWAY STATION AMENITIES AND TECHNOLOGIES AIMED AT DELIVERING A STREAMLINED TRAVEL EXPERIENCE. RESIDENTS IN AREAS OF PERSISTENT POVERTY ALONG THE CORRIDOR WILL MORE EASILY CONNECT WITH RESOURCES AND OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN REASONABLE COMMUTE TIMES.NA; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL ACCELERATE UPWARD MOBILITY FOR THE COMMUNITY ADD MOMENTUM TO PROGRESS THAT IS ALREADY UNDERWAY AND COLLABORATE WITH THE RESIDENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE THE CUMULATIVE IMPACT OF FUTURE INVESTMENTS. CREATING AN ENHANCED TRANSIT CORRIDOR IN THIS AREA WILL PROACTIVELY ADDRESS RACIAL EQUITY BY PROVIDING EASIER ACCESS TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AND REDUCING BARRIERS TO OPPORTUNITY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE 24TH STREET CORRIDOR IS HOME TO A DIVERSE COMMUNITY WITH A LONG HISTORY OF DISCRIMINATION AND DISINVESTMENT. THIS PROJECT WILL CONNECT THE RESIDENTS TO NUMEROUS DESTINATIONS INCLUDING HEALTH CARE FACILITIES CULTURAL DESTINATIONS EDUCATIONAL SERVICES AND SUPPORT SERVICES SAFELY AND CONVENIENTLY. ENHANCED PASSENGER AMENITIES WILL ALLOW FOR SAFE AND CONVENIENT ACCESS TO RESIDENTS IN NORTH AND SOUTH OMAHA.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NA

THE STATEWIDE METROPOLITAN PLANNING PROGRAM (SECTION 5304) FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE DIVISIONS URBAN TRANSIT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES; NEW START AND REGIONAL BUS SERVICE PLANNING ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES; PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION DIVISION-SPONSORED TRAINING WORKSHOPS FOR MANAGERIAL TECHNICAL AND PROFESSIONAL PERSONNEL; AND THE DIVISIONS PROGRAMMATIC AND FINANCIAL ADMINISTRATION OF THE MPO PLANNING PROGRAMS.THIS 5303 FUNDS WILL PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AS THE LEAD PLANNING AGENCY FOR METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATIONS IN URBANIZED AREAS OF OVER 50000 POPULATION TO CONDUCT TRANSIT PLANNING ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SUCH TASKS AS SHORT- AND LONG-RANGE TRANSIT PLANNING TITLE VI PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT FINANCIAL PLANNING TIP MAPPING MANAGEMENT AND OPERATIONS REGIONAL AND STATEWIDE PLANNING AND PLANNING FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED. THE GRANT WILL ALSO BE USED TO SUPPORT THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION DIVISIONS URBAN TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS NEW START REGIONAL BUS SERVICE PLANNING AND STATEWIDE INTEGRATION OF BICYCLE AND PEDESTRIAN PLANNING ACTIVITIES.

THE CITY OF GREENSBORO WAS AWARDED $234000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS UNDER FTAS DISCRETIONARY HELPING OBTAIN PROSPERITY FOR EVERYONE (HOPE) GRANT PROGRAM. THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING USED FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AND THE CITY WILL NOT BE APPLYING INDIRECT COST RATE TO ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE FOR ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT IS DATE OF GRANT AWARD TO MARCH 30 2026. THE GREENSBORO TRANSIT AGENCY (GTA) AND DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (GDOT) ARE UTILIZING HOPE GRANT FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $234000 TO DEVELOP A TECHNICAL PLAN TO PROVIDE FREE BROADBAND INTERNET ACCESS IN PERSISTENT POVERTY CENSUS TRACTS BY USING TRANSIT AND TRANSPORTATION INFRASTRUCTURE. THE PLAN WILL ADDRESS DIGITAL EQUITY OR THE DIGITAL DIVIDE IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES BY PARTNERING WITH THE CITYS IT DEPARTMENT TO BUILD UPON THEIR PREVIOUS PLANNING AND COLLABORATIONS WITH SEVERAL LOCAL PARTNERS.THE CITY WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE). THE CITY OF GREENSBORO WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED ARE NOT ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: FY 2021 AREAS OF PERSISTENT POVERTY PROJECT TO PROVIDE PLANNING DESIGN AND ENGINEERING WORK FOR THE INSTALLATION OF A MOBILITY HUB IN DOWNTOWN PONTIAC MI.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: DESIGN AND ENGINEERING MOBILITY HUB PROJECT TO BE LOCATED IN DOWNTOWN PONTIAC. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION OF LOCATION TO INSTALL MOBILITY HUB AND DESIGN AND ENGINEERING OF MOBILITY HUB. PROJECT AIMS TO EXPAND SHARED USE AND MICRO MOBILITY OPTIONS LIKE BIKE-SHARE SCOOTER-SHARE AND POTENTIALLY CAR-SHARE. IT ALSO WILL INTEGRATE SMARTS ON-DEMAND SERVICE SMARTFLEX AND WILL INCLUDE LAND USE PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT CONCEPTS FROM THE CITY OF PONTIAC AND OAKLAND COUNTY. SOME OF THE AMENITIES THAT WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE DESIGN ARE ENHANCED BUS SHELTERS WITH BENCHES REAL TIME INFORMATION TICKETING/FARE MACHINES WASTE DISPOSAL AND A PARK AND RIDE LOT. SMALL-WHEELED VEHICLE AMENITIES INCLUDE BIKE PARKING (COULD INCLUDE BIKE LOCKERS AND/OR A SECURED STORAGE ROOM) BIKE-SHARE A FIX-IT STATION SCOOTER PARKING AND WHEELCHAIR CHARGERS. THE PEDESTRIAN AMENITIES INCLUDE WAYFINDING CROSSWALKS AND WALKWAYS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: A DOCUMENT IDENTIFYING AVAILABLE LOCATIONS FOR A MOBILITY HUB INCLUDING CONCEPTUAL DESIGNS BUS ROUTING AND AMENITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION USERS THROUGHOUT THE CITY OF PONTIAC AND OAKLAND COUNTY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE GOAL OF THIS AWARD IS TO COMBINE FTA AND FHWA TRANSPORTATION PLANNING FUNDING AS PART OF A CONSOLIDATED PLANNING GRANT THAT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING SUPPORT TO HELP IOWAS NINE METROPOLITAN AND 18 REGIONAL PLANNING AGENCIES COMPLETE THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS (WHILE CONSIDERING PLANNING FACTORS AND PLANNING EMPHASIS AREAS TO ADVANCE NATIONAL GOALS.) IT WILL SUPPORT WORK ON THE AGENCIES TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PRIORITIES AND ACTIVITIES IDENTIFIED IN THEIR RESPECTIVE WORK PROGRAMS OVER THE NEXT ONE-YEAR PERIOD.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE TRANSFERRED FHWA PL AND SPR FUNDS WITH THE FTA SECTION 5305(D) AND 5305(E) FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITY EXPENSES AS OUTLINED IN THE MPO AND RPA WORK PROGRAMS. ACTIVITIES AMONG THE METROPOLITAN AND REGIONAL PLANNING AGENCIES WILL GENERALLY BE ATTRIBUTED ADDRESSING PRIORITIES IDENTIFIED THROUGHOUT THE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS SUCH AS SHORT-RANGE AND LONG-RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING THROUGH DATA COLLECTION STUDIES PLANS GENERAL SUPPORT OF PROGRAM AND ADMINISTRATIVE OPERATIONS AT THE AGENCIES AND CARRYING OUT SIMILAR TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITIES AS PART OF THEIR TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS FOUND IN UNITED STATES CODE.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FUNDING WILL ALLOW THESE METROPOLITAN AND REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING AGENCIES TO CARRY OUT THE REQUIREMENTS OF A CONTINUING COOPERATIVE AND COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS FOR THEIR REGIONAL PLANNING AREA WHILE PERFORMING TRANSPORTATION-RELATED PLANNING AND PROGRAMMING ACTIVITIES FOR FEDERALLY FUNDED HIGHWAY AND TRANSIT PROJECTS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: POPULACE (RESIDENTS OF METROPOLITAN AND NON-METROPOLITAN AREAS SUCH LARGE AND SMALL CITIES COUNTIES) OF NINE MPO AND 18 RPA PLANNING AREAS (STATE OF IOWA).; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE 27 SUBRECIPIENTS HAVE CHOSEN TO UTILIZE FHWA PL FHWA SPR FTA 5305(D) AND FTA 5305(E) FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNITED STATES CODE WHICH ARE IDENTIFIED AS TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED WITHIN THEIR INDIVIDUAL MPO AND RPA PLANNING WORK PROGRAMS. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL GENERALLY INCLUDE WORK RELATED TO LONG RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING SHORT RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND MONITORING GENERAL AND COMPREHENSIVE PLANNING PROGRAM SUPPORT AND ADMINISTRATIVE ITEMS COMPLETE STREETS AND VARIOUS OTHER STUDIES AND PLAN ACTIVITIES.

THIS FY16 GRANT PROVIDES PROJECT FUNDING FOR A) THE OAHU METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION OVERALL WORK PROGRAM (OWP) AND B) HDOT STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING OFFICE (STP) UPDATE FOR ITS STATEWIDE COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES PLAN (CSP).OVERALL SUMMARY OWP: FOR ITS FTA 5303 METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROGRAM OVERALL WORK PROGRAM (OWP) FOR FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR 2016 THE OAHUMPO WILL BE USING FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $259665 (FEDERAL SHARE) FROM THE FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR 2013 APPORTIONMENT FOR ITS 44.21.00 PROGRAM SUPPORT ADMINISTRATION ACTIVITIES. THE FY16 OAHUMPO OVERALL WORK PROGRAM WAS APPROVED ON JULY 30 2015 BY FHWA MAYELA SOSA (DIVISION ADMINISTRATOR - HAWAII AND FTA LESLIE T. ROGERS REGIONAL ADMINISTRATOR - FTA). OWP PROJECT COST ITEMIZATON: TOTAL PROJECT COST: $324581TOTAL FEDERAL SHARE: $259665TOTAL LOCAL SHARE: $ 64916OWP PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE 5303 FUNDS ARE TO FUND THE OAHUMPOS FY 2016 OVERALL WORK PROGRAM (OWP) WHICH SERVES AS THE KEY MANAGEMENT TOOL FOR MONITORING STATE AND CITY TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITIES ON OAHU. OVERALL SUMMARY CSP: THE HDOT STP OFFICE WILL BE USING $65380 (FEDERAL SHARE) OF THE FY13 STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING FUNDS TO UPDATE ITS STATEWIDE COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES PLAN (CSP). THESE FUNDS REPRESENT JUST A PORTION OF THE ANTICIPATED PROJECTED COST OF UPDATING THE CSP (TO BE DETERMINED LATER). HDOT CSP PROJECT COST ITEMIZATION:TOTAL PROJECT COST: $81725TOTAL FEDERAL SHARE: $65380TOTAL LOCAL SHARE: $16345HDOT CSP PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE ORIGINAL CSP WHICH WAS FUNDED IN FY13 5303 GRANT HI-80-0018 USING MULTI-YEAR APPORTIONMENTS IS REQUIRED TO BE UPDATED. THE UPDATED CSP CONTINUES THE PURPOSE OF THE ORIGINAL CSP BY ENSURING TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR THE ELDERLY DISABLED SOCIALLY AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED SITUATED WITHIN THE NON-URBANIZED AREAS OF THE STATE OF HAWAII.AT MINIMUM THE UPDATED CSP WILL THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE COORDINATED STATEWIDE OUTREACH EFFORT IDENTIFY AND SOLICIT PERTINENT INFORMATION FROM THE VARIOUS PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS AND TRANSPORTATION USER GROUPS AND BUILD UPON THE CSP TO BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF THE NON-METROPOLITAN AREA SUB-RECIPIENTS. THIS PROCESS IS ENVISIONED TO PROVIDE MAXIMUM COLLECTIVE COVERAGE OF THE VARIOUS FTA PROGRAMS WHILE THE EFFORT IS ENVISION TO YIELD 1) THE IDENTIFICATION AND MINIMIZATION OF DUPLICATE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SERVICES; 2) THE IDENTIFICATION AND FILLING OF MISSING SERVICE GAPS; AND 3) THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF A COLLABORATIVE COORDINATED EFFORT OF THE PUBLIC PRIVATE AND NON-PROFIT HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS.THE CSP WILL BE PREPARED IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPLICABLE FTA GUIDELINES THAT INCLUDE: 1) COMPREHENSIVE OUTREACH EFFORTS; 2) THE IDENTIFICATION OF EXISTING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES; 3) THE IDENTIFICATION OF THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF THE ELDERLY DISABLED SOCIALLY AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED PERSONS; AND 4) THE DEVELOPMENT OF VIABLE STRATEGIES FOR EFFECTIVE COORDINATION OF THE VARIOUS HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST FY2019 SECTION 5304 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF HAWAII DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (HDOT) IN THE AMOUNT OF $119571 APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF HAWAII. A SUMMARY AND BREAKDOWN OF FUNDING REQUESTED IS PROVIDED BELOW:SUMMARY OF FUNDING FOR THIS APPLICATION:5304 FY2019: FEDERAL = $119571 / LOCAL MATCH = $29893 / TOTAL = $149464PURPOSE: THE STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING OFFICE OF THE HAWAII DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (HDOT) WILL DEVELOP THE HAWAII TRAVEL DEMAND AND FREIGHT FORECASTING MODEL (HTDF2M) TO PROVIDE HDOT AND OTHER TRANSPORTATION PARTNERS WITH A MULTI-MODAL TRAVEL DEMAND MODEL THAT FORECASTS TRAVEL BY HAWAII RESIDENTS AS WELL AS ALL COMMERCIAL VEHICLE TRAVEL THROUGHOUT THE STATE. HTDF2M WILL BE FULLY INTEGRATED TO CAPTURE PASSENGER AND FREIGHT TRIPS TOGETHER AND WILL COVER BOTH INTRA-ISLAND AND INTER-ISLAND TRAVELS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: (THESE ACTIVITIES WILL ESTABLISH THE PARAMETERS TO DEVELOP A TRAVEL DEMAND MODEL.)- TASK 1 REVIEW HDOT REQUIREMENTS AND DEVELOP A BLUEPRINT FOR HTDF2M THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK IS TO REVIEW HDOTS REQUIREMENTS FOR A STATEWIDE TRAVEL DEMAND AND FREIGHT FORECASTING MODEL AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS THAT WILL GUIDE THE MODEL DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION TASKS OF THIS PROJECT. RECOMMENDATIONS WILL BE DEVELOPED IN FOUR GENERAL CATEGORIES.- TASK 1.1 POLICY REVIEW: THIS SUB-TASK WILL REVIEW FEDERAL AND STATE LEGISLATIVE REQUIREMENTS HAWAII STATEWIDE TRANSPORTATION PLAN MULTIMODAL LONG-RANGE PLANS (HIGHWAYS) MPO LONG-RANGE PLANS AND SYSTEM AND MASTER PLANS (AIRPORTS AND HARBORS) FOR A NEED FOR A STATEWIDE HTDF2M. THE SUB-TASK WILL ALSO INCLUDE INTERACTION WITH KEY AGENCIES AND STAKEHOLDERS.- TASK 1.2 PURPOSE OF THE MODEL: THE PURPOSE OF THE SUB-TASK IS TO DETERMINE HOW STATEWIDE MODELS WILL BE USED AND TO GIVE AN OVERALL VISION FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE MODEL. IT WILL ALSO PROVIDE BACKGROUND FROM THE LITERATURE ON STATEWIDE MODEL DEVELOPMENT EXPERIENCES AND MODEL USES. - TASK 1.3: DESIGN OPTIONS: THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK IS TO CREATE A FRAMEWORK FOR DEVELOPING THE STATEWIDE MODEL. DEPENDING ON THE OUTPUT OF TASK 1.1 AND 1.2 A PHASED AND/OR DIFFERENT LEVEL OF SOPHISTICATION AND DATA COSTS ALTERNATES COULD BE DEVELOPED. - TASK 1.4 DATA NEEDS: THIS SUB-TASK WILL DETAIL DATA NEEDS FOR DIFFERENT DESIGN OPTIONS OF THE STATEWIDE MODEL. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE HTDF2M WILL SUPPLEMENT EXISTING OAHU MPO AND MAUI MPO TRAVEL FORECASTING MODELS AND HELP HDOT PLAN FOR AND EVALUATE THE IMPACTS OF THE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM ON THE ECONOMY ENVIRONMENT TRAFFIC CONGESTION MOBILITY AIR QUALITY FUEL CONSUMPTION GHG EMISSIONS PUBLIC HEALTH CLIMATE CHANGE AND EQUITY ANALYSIS. FUNDING ON THIS GRANT WILL RESULT IN A BLUEPRINT FOR THE HTDF2M AS A DELIVERABLE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE STATE OF HAWAII AS WELL AS THE TOURISM AND COMMERCIAL FREIGHT INDUSTRIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE HTDF2M.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONENOTES: THIS GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDES FUNDS LAPSING ON 09/30/2022. SUBSEQUENT TASKS ON THE HTDF2M WILL BE SUPPORTED BY FHWA STATE PLANNING AND RESEARCH (SPR) PART 1 FUNDING.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE $75000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS FOR THE HELPING OBTAIN PROSPERITY FOR EVERYONE (HOPE) PROGRAM (D2020-HOPE-007) TO FDOT - PUTNAM COUNTY FOR A TRANSIT PLANNING STUDY FOR SERVICES AND ROUTES. THESE FUNDS WERE APPROPRIATED PURSUANT TO DIVISION H OF THE FURTHER CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS ACT 2020 (PUB. L. 11694) AND WAS AWARDED THROUGH A COMPETITIVE PROCESS THROUGH FTA. THIS GRANT WILL HAVE A 10% MATCH PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL AGENCIES IN THE FORM OF IN-KIND SERVICES IN THE AMOUNT OF $8334. THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF THIS GRANT IS $83334 ($75000 IN FEDERAL FUNDS AND $8334 IN LOCAL IN-KIND FUNDS).; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL USE NEW APPROACHES TO MOBILITY PLANNING DESIGN FORWARD-THINKING SERVICES AND TRANSFORM THE WAY FUTURE TRANSIT FACILITIES ARE CONSTRUCTED. IT WILL USE CROWDSOURCING EVENTS TO CHALLENGE THE PUBLIC TO DEVELOP AND RANK INNOVATIVE IDEAS FOR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE DELIVERY DATA EXCHANGE AND COLLABORATION. THESE FRESH IDEAS WILL BE FURTHER EXPLORED TO DEVELOP INNOVATIVE SERVICE IMPLEMENTATION PLANS AND TRANSFORM TRANSIT FACILITIES TO BE SAFER FOR THESE SERVICES.THE PROJECT DEVELOPS A PLAN FOR RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES TO USE TO TRANSPORT LOW-INCOME RURAL RESIDENTS TO JOBS. RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES TYPICALLY DO NOT HAVE PLANNING STAFF NOR THE FUNDS TO PERFORM PLANNING ACTIVITIES. THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE ROUTES INITIATIVE BY ALLOWING THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA REGIONAL COUNCIL TO PERFORM PLANNING ACTIVITIES ON BEHALF OF RURAL TRANSIT AGENCIES AND HOUSING AUTHORITIES. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO HELP IMPROVE THE SAFETY OF VEHICLES AND DRIVERS OPERATING ON RURAL ROADS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: COMPLETE DEVELOPMENT OF A PLAN FOR INNOVATIVE MOBILITY SOLUTIONS TO CONNECT RESIDENTS IN RURAL AREAS TO JOBS AND HEALTHCARE FACILITIES IN THE REGION. THE PLAN WILL EVALUATE THE VIABILITY AND SAFETY OF ADDING MICRO-TRANSIT SERVICE TO THE TRANSPORTATION NETWORK.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PUTNAM COUNTY CONTAINS THREE OPPORTUNITY ZONES (12107951401 12107920900 AND 12107950800) PRIMARILY IN AND ADJACENT TO THE CITIES OF PALATKA AND CRESCENT CITY. WHILE SOME LOCAL TRANSIT SERVICE IS AVAILABLE MORE REGIONAL SERVICES WILL BE PLANNED THROUGH PROJECT FUNDING. THE PROJECT WILL HELP CONNECT LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS TO ACCESS EMPLOYMENT HUBS IN THE REST OF THE REGION. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO BE EASILY TRANSFERABLE TO ANOTHER TWENTY OPPORTUNITY ZONES THROUGHOUT THE NORTHEAST FLORIDA REGION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE 2 YEARS OF FUNDING FOR MPP INITIATIVES IN THE METROPOLITAN WASHINGTON URBANIZED AREA. THE FY 2020 AND 2021 UPWPS FOR MWCOG INCORPORATE IN ONE DOCUMENT ALL FEDERALLY-ASSISTED STATE REGIONAL AND LOCAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITIES PROPOSED TO BE UNDERTAKEN IN THE REGION FROM JULY 1 2020 THROUGH MARCH 30 2023.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER TRANSIT PLANNING ACTIVITIES INCLUDING TIP/STIP/UPWP DEVELOPMENT TRANSIT STUDIES AND LONG-RANGE PLAN UPDATES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ENSURE THAT THE DDOT MEETS APPLICABLE PLANNING REQUIREMENTS AND FUTURE PROJECTS ARE APPROPRIATELY PROGRAMMED IN THE UPWP. THE UPWP PROVIDES A MECHANISM TO COORDINATE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY THE TPB. IT IS REQUIRED AS A BASIS AND CONDITION FOR ALL FEDERAL FUNDING ASSISTANCE FOR TRANSPORTATION PLANNING BY THE JOINT PLANNING REGULATIONS OF FHWA AND FTA. MWCOG SERVES AS THE ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR THE TPB. PLANNING DOCUMENTS PRODUCED WILL DOCUMENT A COORDINATED TRANSPORTATION PLANNING EFFORT AND ACTIVITIES IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS: LONG RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PLAN PLANNING ELEMENTS PUBLIC PARTICIPATION TRAVEL FORECASTING MOBILE EMISSIONS PLANNING TRAVEL MONITORING AND DATA PROGRAMS SCENARIO PLANNING AND SOCIOECONOMIC FORECASTING MOBILITY AND ENHANCEMENT PROGRAMS TPB MANAGEMENT AND SUPPORT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND CONTINUOUS AIRPORT SYSTEM PLANNING PROGRAM.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE NATIONAL CAPITAL REGION TRANSPORTATION PLANNING BOARD (TPB) IS THE FEDERALLY DESIGNATED METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (MPO) FOR METROPOLITAN WASHINGTON. IT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DEVELOPING AND CARRYING OUT A CONTINUING COOPERATIVE AND COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS IN THE METROPOLITAN AREA. MEMBERS OF THE TPB INCLUDE REPRESENTATIVES OF THE TRANSPORTATION AGENCIES OF THE STATES OF MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA AND THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA 23 LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THE WASHINGTON METROPOLITAN AREA TRANSIT AUTHORITY THE MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA GENERAL ASSEMBLIES AND NON-VOTING MEMBERS FROM THE METROPOLITAN WASHINGTON AIRPORTS AUTHORITY AND FEDERAL AGENCIES. THESE ENTITIES WILL BE THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE COORDINATED PLANNING EFFORTS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN IN PARTNERSHIP WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS FOR ZERO-EMISSION MOBILITY THAT FILL GAPS IN THE TRANSIT NETWORK AND INCREASES ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITY FOR HARTFORD RESIDENTS. WE WILL EVALUATE EXISTING AND POTENTIAL MOBILITY HUBS THAT COULD HOUSE COMMUNITY-CONTROLLED MOBILITY PROGRAMS RESPONSIVE TO NEIGHBORHOOD NEEDS INCLUDING SHARED E-BIKES ELECTRIC CARSHARE SHARED PASSENGER SERVICES AND/OR OTHER OPTIONS IDENTIFIED BY THE COMMUNITY.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: TASK 1: EXISTING CONDITIONS ANALYSIS THIS TASK WILL KICK-OFF THE PROJECT AND INCLUDE POLICY AND PROGRAM RESEARCH FOR WHAT RELEVANT POLICIES AND PROGRAMS RELATED TO ZERO-EMISSION MOBILITY EXISTING WITHIN THE CITY OF HARTFORD THE GREATER HARTFORD REGION AND AMONG OTHER PEER CITIES/AGENCIES WHO HAVE ALREADY PILOTED THIS APPROACH (BUFFALO ROCHESTER CAMBRIDGE ETC). THIS WILL ALSO INCLUDE SOME PRELIMINARY DATA ANALYSIS AND FINANCIAL MODELING TO UNDERSTAND THE ECONOMICS OF THE FUTURE PROGRAM AND WHAT SORT OF FUTURE GOVERNMENT SUPPORT / PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP WILL BE REQUIRED TO ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF THE PROGRAM.TASK 2: COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT DIRECTLY ENGAGING THE COMMUNITY LEVERAGING CULTIVATED RELATIONSHIPS WITH GRASSROOTS ORGANIZATIONS AND SPECIFICALLY BY SETTING UP AN EQUITY CABINET AS ONE OF THE FIRST PHASES/DELIVERABLES. DURING THE INITIAL PHASES THE NEEDS ASSESSMENT WILL BE DESIGNED BY THE EQUITY CABINET AND IMPLEMENTED BY LOCAL COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS WITH THE INPUT OF RESIDENTS. THIS ASSESSMENT IS A VITAL PART OF THE PROJECT AS IT WILL INFORM THE NEEDS DESIGN AND STRUCTURE OF THE TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM. LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS WILL FACILITATE COMMUNITY CONVERSATIONS AND RESIDENTS WILL PROVIDE DIRECT INPUT AND FEEDBACK ON PROGRAM NEEDS. BY CREATING OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY-BASED DIALOGUE RESIDENTS AND STAKEHOLDERS WILL BECOME MORE INVESTED IN AND SUPPORTIVE OF FUTURE EFFORTS. BY ENGAGING NEIGHBORHOODS IN THE PROGRAM DESIGN WE WILL BE ABLE TO DESIGN NEW MOBILITY SERVICES THAT SPECIFICALLY ADDRESS: A) THE LAST-MILE PROBLEMS OF THE EXISTING SYSTEM; AND B) EXISTING MOBILITY DESIRE LINES THAT ARENT SEEN OR EVALUATED BY FIXED ROUTES. ON-DEMAND AND SHARED-USE PROGRAMS WILL INCREASE RESIDENT ACCESS RELIABILITY AND MOBILITY. METHODS WILL INCLUDE (BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO) FOCUS GROUPS STAKEHOLDER INTERVIEWS AND OTHER TO-BE-DETERMINED METHODS PROPOSED AND DESIGNED BY THE EQUITY CABINET THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRETY OF THE PROJECT. ALL PARTICIPANTS WILL BE COMPENSATED FOR THEIR PARTICIPATION. TASK 3: QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE DATA ANALYSIS UPON COMPLETION OF TASK 1 AND TASK 2 THERE WILL BE A ROBUST QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DATA ANALYSIS AND SYNTHESIS EFFORT TO COMBINE THE RESULTS FROM EXISTING CONDITIONS AND THE COMMUNITY CONVERSATIONS. THIS ANALYSIS WILL BE BOLSTERED BY METHODS UTILIZED IN REGIONAL PUBLIC AND EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS TO AMALGAMATE QUALITY DATA INTO A REPORT USED BY THE EQUITY CABINET TO DESIGN THE STRUCTURE OF THE PROGRAM.TASK 4: PROGRAM DESIGN AFTER COMPLETING THE ANALYSIS THE PROJECT PARTNERS WILL THEN FOCUS ON THE DESIGN OF A PILOT PROGRAM AND DEVELOPMENT OF AN IMPLEMENTATION PLAN. THESE RECOMMENDATIONS WILL BE CO-CREATED WITH THE COMMUNITY AND LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS AND TAKEN THROUGH A SECOND PHASE OF COMMUNITY CONVERSATIONS. DRIVEN BY COMMUNITY-BASED CONSENSUS STAKEHOLDERS WILL PAVE THE WAY FOR AN IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY THAT IDENTIFIES AND BRIDGES TRANSPORTATION GAPS WHILE ALSO CONSIDERING FUTURE EXPANSION. THE GOVERNANCE MODEL WILL INCLUDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY-CONTROLLED MOBILITY SOLUTIONS. THE PROJECT AIMS TO REFLECT OUR COMMUNITYS SHARED VISION FOR A HARTFORD THAT IS DRAMATICALLY MORE SUSTAINABLE EQUITABLE MOBILE PROSPEROUS LOCALLY-OWNED AND VIBRANT.TASK 5: GHTD ADMINISTRATION THIS TASK PROVIDES THE FINANCIAL AND STAFF SUPPORT FROM THE GREATER HARTFORD TRANSIT DISTRICT TO ASSIST WITH THE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND ADMINISTRATION.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: -INCREASE IN UNDERSTANDING OF BENEFITS OF ZERO-EMISSION MOBILITY OPTIONS BY ENGAGING AND EDUCATING RESIDENTS OF HARTFORD -CREATE COMMUNITY CHAMPIONS / NEIGHBORHOOD AMBASSADORS FOR SHARED MOBILITY VIA THE EQUITY CABINET -DEVELOP FINANCIAL PARAMETERS OF A GOVERNMENT-RUN OR PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP FOR ZERO-EMISSION MOBILITY PROGRAM IN HARTFORD-DESIGN SHOVEL-READY IMPLEMENTATION PLAN FOR ZERO-EMISSION MOBILITY PROGRAM THAT CAN BE OPERATIONALIZED UPON IDENTIFIED FUNDING PARTNERS-REDUCTION IN GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS DUE TO SHIFTING TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AWAY FROM THE PERSONAL AUTOMOBILE; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES FOR THE PROGRAM ARE RESIDENTS OF HARTFORD OVER THE AGE OF 16 WHO NEED AFFORDABLE ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS TO TRAVEL SHORT DISTANCES THROUGHOUT THE CITY TO GET TO AND FROM HOME WORK AND ERRANDS. WE WILL SPECIFICALLY BE TARGETING LOW-INCOME AND OTHER DISADVANTAGED RESIDENTS TO ENGAGE WITH THE PROGRAM THROUGH THE EQUITY CABINET.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE CITY OF HARTFORD IS THE SUBRECIPIENT OF THESE FUNDS AND WILL BE MANAGER ALL PROJECT ACTIVITIES OUTSIDE OF GRANT ADMINISTRATION.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: RTD WILL USE THE FULL AMOUNT OF $180000 IN FFY 2020 DISCRETIONARY HELPING OBTAIN PROSPERITY FOR EVERYONE (HOPE) FUNDS IN THIS APPLICATION. RTD WILL CONDUCT A TRANSIT NEEDS ASSESSMENT TO DETERMINE HOW CURRENT TRANSIT SERVICES MAY BE IMPROVED TO BETTER SERVE PEOPLE IN PERSISTENT POVERTY AND INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS IN THE DENVER METRO AREA. THROUGH THIS STUDY RTD WILL BE ABLE TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO SUPPORT SERVICES FOR THE POPULATION IN NEED.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS TRANSIT NEEDS STUDY WILL CONSIST OF THREE PRIMARY COMPONENTS: PUBLIC OUTREACH LED BY A COMMUNITY LIAISON A FORMAL SURVEY TARGETING POPULATIONS IN POVERTY THE HOMELESS AND THOSE NEEDING ADDICTION SERVICES AS WELL AS A NEEDS ANALYSIS WHICH WILL MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE RTD BOARD OF DIRECTORS ON HOW TO IMPROVE TRANSIT SERVICES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BY IMPROVING TRANSIT SERVICES SPECIFICALLY FOR INDIVIDUALS IN POVERTY RTD WILL INCREASE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOR THOSE THAT MOST NEED IT. THIS WILL HAVE POSITIVE EFFECTS ON ECONOMIC VITALITY (OBJ A). SECONDLY THIS PROJECT WILL BE A TRANSIT NEEDS STUDY THAT WILL IMPROVE TRANSIT SERVICES IN MANY OPPORTUNITY ZONES THROUGHOUT THE AREA RTD SERVES (OBJ D). FINALLY THIS PROJECT WILL ACHIEVE SPECIFIC OUTCOMES CHANGES IN TRANSIT SERVICE ADOPTED BY THE RTD BOARD (OBJ F).; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON CENSUS TRACTS WITH A POVERTY RATE OF AT LEAST 20 PERCENT AS MEASURED BY THE 20132017 AMERICAN COMMUNITY SURVEY AND WILL BE CONDUCTED OVER APPROXIMATELY ONE YEAR.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

THIS APPLICATION UTILIZES FUNDING FROM THE HOPE PROGRAM. GOLDEN EMPIRE TRANSIT (GET BUS) IN BAKERSFIELD WILL RECEIVE FUNDING TO INTRODUCE ADVANCED-TECHNOLOGY FUELING SYSTEMS FOR ITS BUS FLEET. PARTNERING WITH CALSTART GET BUS WILL ASSESS AND DETERMINE FACILITY UPGRADES TO DEPLOY ON-SITE HYDROGEN FUEL CELL-POWERED BUSES TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND EXTEND BUS SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE REGION. OVERALL GRANT FUNDING:TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS (D2020-HOPE-001 UZA 060000): $160225TOTAL LOCAL (TDA) MATCH: $40064TOTAL PROJECT COST: $200319PURPOSE OF THE AWARD:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ASSESS AND DETERMINE FACILITY UPGRADES TO DEPLOY ON-SITE HYDROGEN FUEL CELL-POWERED BUSES TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND EXTEND BUS SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE REGION BY COMPLETING A SERIES OF STUDIES THAT INCLUDE:1) HYDROGEN DEMAND ANALYSIS 2) HYDROGEN FUELING INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYMENT ANALYSIS 3) GHG EMISSION COMPARISON AND 4) COST PROJECTIONS FOR INFRASTRUCTURE AND FLEET VEHICLES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THESE STUDIES SUPPORTS THE OBJECTIVES OF THE HOPE PROGRAM AND THE ROUTES INITIATIVE BY HELPING TO ADDRESS A MAJOR PROBLEM FOR THE PEOPLE IN AREAS OF PERSISTENT POVERTY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS LIVING IN LOW-INCOME AREAS THAT DO NOT HAVE RELIABLE ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION TO GET THEM TO APPOINTMENTS AND JOBS. DESCRIPTION- PURPOSE: STUDY THREE CLUSTERS IN THE BIRMINGHAM ALABAMA METROPOLITAN AREA TO DEVELOP PLANS FOR IMPROVING TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND LAND USE TO CONNECT RESIDENTS OF PERSISTENTLY IMPOVERISHED AREAS TO THE BRT JOBS HEALTHCARE AND SERVICES TO INCLUDE THE POTENTIAL FOR TRANSIT ORIENTED DEVELOPMENT COMPLETE STREETS ACCESSIBILITY AND ENHANCEMENT OF BUS STOPS AND USE OF BLIGHTED VACANT AND UNDERUTILIZED PROPERTIES. - ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: GRANT ADMINISTRATION DATA COLLECTION (DEMOGRAPHIC TRAFFIC TRANSIT ECONOMIC LAND USE ETC.) TRANSIT SERVICE ANALYSIS MARKET ANALYSIS PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT PLAN DEVELOPMENT - EXPECTED OUTCOME: DETERMINE PREFERRED ALTERNATIVE AND DEVELOP PLAN WITH BUDGET/COST - INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESIDENTS LIVING IN AREAS IDENTIFIED AS BEING PERSISTENT IMPOVERISHED - SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: CONSULTANT WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR CONDUCTING THE STUDY DETERMINING A PREFERRED ALTERNATIVE AND DEVELOPING THE PLAN DOCUMENT.4. THE PROJECT IN THIS APPLICATION IS FROM SCOPE 442 PROGRAMMED OVER 2 ALIS AND COVERS 2.5 YEARS.ALIS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:44.21.00 PROGRAM SUPPORT ADMINISTRATION44.27.00 OTHER ACTIVITIES5. $49500 OF THE APPORTIONMENT WILL BE USED FOR STATE/PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION WITH NO LOCAL MATCH REQUIRED (100% FEDERAL). ADMINISTRATION ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CREATING A TRAMS APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT OF AN RFP FOR CONSULTANT SERVICES REVIEW AND SELECTION OF CONSULTANT CONSULTANT CONTRACT PAYMENT OF INVOICES AND CERTIFY CONSULTANT COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS.6. RPCGB IS A DIRECT RECIPIENT OF FTA FUNDS.7. RPCGB WILL FOLLOW ALL THIRD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFIND IN C4220.1F THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE.8. RPCGB WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED ARE NOT ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST. 9. THE PROJECT IN THIS APPLICATION IS PROGRAMMED IN THE BIRMINGHAM MPO UNIFIED PLANNING WORK PROGRAM.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE MUNICIPALITY OF ANCHORAGE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION DEPARTMENT SEEKS TO IMPROVE A DIVERSE LOW INCOME MINORITY POPULATED NEIGHBORHOOD LOCATED IN NORTHEAST ANCHORAGE WITH A MIXED-USE TRANSIT-ORIENTED DEVELOPMENT. THIS PROJECT WILL CONSOLIDATE NUMEROUS BUS STOPS AND TRANSFER POINTS ALONG TWO FIVE-LANE ROADS THAT CURRENTLY PRESENT SAFETY ACCESS AND MOBILITY CONCERNS FOR THIS GROWING AREA OF TOWN.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PLANNING DESIGN AND ENGINEERING TO DEVELOP A SUMMARY OF FEASIBLE ALTERNATIVES TO RELOCATE THE EXISTING COLLECTION OF BUS STOPS KNOWN AS THE MULDOON TRANSIT HUB TO AN OFF-STREET LOCATION (ONE FACILITY).; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVE SAFETY FOR PEDESTRIANS ACCOMMODATE PASSENGER TRANSFER AND TRAVEL NEEDS MAINTAIN EFFICIENT TRANSIT OPERATIONS AND PROVIDE OPERATOR CONVENIENCES; IMPROVE TRAVEL CONDITIONS; SUPPORT THE ECONOMY BY ENHANCING TOURIST TRAVEL TO MAJOR COMMERCIAL CENTER AND SUPPORTING LOCAL JOB GROWTH BY PROVIDING BETTER ACCESS; AND PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY BY COORDINATED TRANSIT WITH EXISTING LAND USE THAT SUPPORTS INTERMODAL CONNECTIONS THUS REDUCING THE RELIANCE OF SINGLE OCCUPANCY AUTO TRIPS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PASSENGERS PEDESTRIANS RESIDENTS; CONNECTING SENIOR HOUSING MIDDLE SCHOOL LOW-INCOME HOUSING LOCAL BUSINESSES AND THE UNDERSERVED MULDOON COMMUNITY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

PROJECT TITLE: FFY 23/24 FAST PLANNING UPWP :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE UNIFIED PLANNING WORK PROGRAM (UPWP) IDENTIFIES ALL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING AND/OR AIR QUALITY PLANNING OR PROGRAMMING ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE FAIRBANKS, ALASKA, METROPOLITAN PLANNING AREA, REGARDLESS OF FUNDING SOURCE. IT DELINEATES TASKS FOR WHICH FEDERAL ASSISTANCE IS SOUGHT FORM THE FEDERAL HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION (FHWA) AND THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) OF THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION. LINES 1&3 ARE FHWA HIGHWAYS PLANNING, LINES 2 & 4 ARE FTA TRANSIT PLANNING. MATCH IS PROVIDED BY FAST PLANNING. THIS IS A LOCAL MATCH PROJECT.

PROJECT TITLE: CY22/23 AMATS UPWP :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: THE UNIFIED PLANNING WORK PROGRAM (UPWP) IDENTIFIES ALL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING AND/OR AIR QUALITY PLANNING OR PROGRAMMING ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE METROPOLITAN AREAS OF THE MUNICIPALITY OF ANCHORAGE (MOA), ALASKA REGARDLESS OF FUNDING SOURCE. ITDELINEATES TASKS FOR WHICH FEDERAL ASSISTANCE IS SOUGHT FROM THE FEDERAL HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION (FHWA) AND THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) OF THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE FOR THIS PROGRAM IS JANUARY 1, 2022 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2023.
